bamboo/CL:棵[ke1],支[zhi1],根[gen1]/Kangxi radical 118
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)

sentences.english: Hereby, the learners of Guzheng should make great efforts to push forward the art of Guzheng music.
sentences.chinese: 筝乐艺术在习筝人数的不断扩增中得到传承和发展。

sentences.english: The Chaozhou zither is one of its large genres.
sentences.chinese: 潮州筝就是其中的一大流派。

sentences.english: Guzheng, also called Chinese zither, is one of the oldest Chinese musical plucking instruments.
sentences.chinese: 筝，又称为古筝，是中国最古老的弹拨乐器之一。

sentences.english: He was very good at playing the Zheng, a plucked string instrument. But he also behaved foolishly sometimes.
sentences.chinese: 他的筝弹得非常好，但有时会作些傻事。

sentences.english: The rhyme as a Zheng music of Shaanxi Province, Mr Zhou Yuguo composition.
sentences.chinese: 《乡韵》作为一首陕西筝曲，由周煜国先生作曲。

definition: xiao, a Chinese musical instrument of ancient times, similar to panpipes
guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general
variant of 琴[qin2], guqin or zither
konghou (Chinese harp)
zither or guzheng/large zither with 13 to 25 strings, developed from guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] during Tang and Song times
(phonetics) voiceless sound
pipa, Chinese lute, with 4 strings, a large pear-shaped body and a fretted fingerboard
sheng, a free reed wind instrument with vertical bamboo pipes
flute
guqin or qin, a long zither with seven strings, plucked with the fingers
liuqin lute, smaller version of the pipa 琵琶, with holes in the soundbox, and range similar to that of a violin
whistle made of reed
qin and se, two string instruments that play in perfect harmony/marital harmony
bamboo flute/CL:管[guan3]
yueqin, a lute with oval or octagonal sound box
huqin/family of Chinese two-stringed fiddles, with snakeskin covered wooden soundbox and bamboo bow with horsehair bowstring
ocarina/wind instrument consisting of an egg-shaped chamber with holes
